item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TypeScript types can run DOOM [video] (342 points | 86 comments)
2. Your camera can take 3D photos. Your screen can display 3D photos. (40 points | 35 comments)
3. Launch HN: Maritime Fusion (YC W25) – Fusion Reactors for Ships (70 points | 77 comments)
4. The Man Who Spent Forty-Two Years at the Beverly Hills Hotel Pool (1993) (39 points | 28 comments)
5. Show HN: Tach – Visualize and untangle your Python codebase (50 points | 11 comments)
6. Skopje’s eccentric post office (2021) (16 points | 2 comments)
7. DARPA Large Bio-Mechanical Space Structures (51 points | 14 comments)
8. Show HN: A Database Written in Golang (116 points | 43 comments)
9. ForeverVM: Run AI-generated code in stateful sandboxes that run forever (48 points | 19 comments)
10. Long division verified via Hoare logic (33 points | 14 comments)
11. The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention (305 points | 111 comments)
12. Show HN: Breakout with a roguelite/vampire survivor twist (141 points | 54 comments)
13. Alexa+ (78 points | 94 comments)
14. Bifurcation: The secret giant islands formed when rivers split (47 points | 10 comments)
15. The Miserable State of Modems and Mobile Network Operators (91 points | 19 comments)
16. Rediscovering Quaternions (17 points | 3 comments)
17. Living in your programming environment [pdf] (26 points | 4 comments)
18. Ask HN: Who Are Your Favorite Photography and Generative Coding Artists? (76 points | 36 comments)
19. I Went to SQL Injection Court (1106 points | 393 comments)
20. Telescope – an open-source web-based log viewer for logs stored in ClickHouse (144 points | 56 comments)
21. DeepGEMM: clean and efficient FP8 GEMM kernels with fine-grained scaling (373 points | 64 comments)
22. Ghost House – software for automatic inbetweens (94 points | 3 comments)
23. Show HN: Instantly Translate Manga – TranslateManga (7 points | 3 comments)
24. Microsoft is Getting Rusty [video] (10 points | discuss)
25. Hyperspace (796 points | 417 comments)
26. State of emergency declared after blackout plunges most of Chile into darkness (157 points | 143 comments)
27. Part two of Grant Sanderson's video with Terry Tao on the cosmic distance ladder (356 points | 77 comments)
28. Launch HN: Browser Use (YC W25) – open-source web agents (230 points | 90 comments)
29. The journalists training AI models for Meta and OpenAI (75 points | 29 comments)
30. Ggwave: Tiny Data-over-Sound Library (260 points | 66 comments)
